snippet: On May 1, 1992, Rodney King, a black man who had been beaten by Los Angeles police officers, appeared in public to appeal for calm after the acquittal of the officers led to rioting.
abstract: On May 1, 1992, Rodney King, a black man who had been beaten by Los Angeles police officers, appeared in public to appeal for calm after the acquittal of the officers led to rioting.

headline.main: May 1, 1992 | Rodney King Asks, 'Can We All Get Along?'
